day1.title: National Corn on the Cob Day

facts.1: Corn on the cob is a popular summer food in the United States, often enjoyed at barbecues and picnics.
facts.2: The average ear of corn has about 800 kernels, arranged in 16 rows.
facts.3: Corn is grown on every continent except Antarctica.

facts.1: German chocolate cake is named after Samuel German, an American baker who developed a type of dark baking chocolate.
facts.2: The cake is known for its rich, sweet chocolate flavor and coconut-pecan frosting.
facts.3: German chocolate cake was first created in the 19th century and has since become a popular dessert in the United States.

facts.1: King Kamehameha Day is a public holiday in Hawaii, celebrated on June 11th to honor King Kamehameha the Great.
facts.2: The holiday features floral parades, hula competitions, and other cultural events.
facts.3: King Kamehameha I is known for uniting the Hawaiian Islands in 1810.
